item.title: Jessica add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "Children aren't coloring books. You don't get to fill them with your favorite colors." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "There is only one sin. and that is theft... when you tell a lie, you steal someones right to the truth." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "There was a thing called Heaven; but all the same they used to drink enormous quantities of alcohol." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Aldous Huxley
Jessica add a quote by Johann Georg Zimmermann
item.description: "Beauty is worse than wine, it intoxicates both the holder and the beholder." -- Johann Georg Zimmermann

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Every man with a little leisure and enough money for railway tickets, every man, indeed, who knows how to read, has it in his power to magnify himself, to multiply the ways in which he exists, to make his life full, significant and interesting." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Chronic remorse, as all the moralists are agreed, is a most undesirable sentiment. If you have behaved badly, repent, make what amends you can and address yourself to the task of behaving better next time. On no account brood over your wrongdoing. Rolling in the muck is not the best way of getting clean." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Jessica add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jessica add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Jessica add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Remember, we're madly in love, so it's all right to kiss me anytime you feel like it." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Jessica add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "All men are liars, said Roberta Muldoon, who knew this was true because she had once been a man." -- John Irving

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Burdens are for shoulders strong enough to carry them." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Joshilyn Jackson
item.description: "There are gods in Alabama: Jack Daniel's, high school quarterbacks, trucks, big tits, and also Jesus." -- Joshilyn Jackson

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Joshilyn Jackson
item.description: "I had been born and mostly raised in the South, so I ought to have been able to find a way to reach him. Southern girls are trained from birth up that the way to a man's heart is never through the front door. They may leave a basket of cookies there, and while he's busy picking them up, they're squirming in through a back window." -- Joshilyn Jackson

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Jeannette Walls
Jessica add a quote by Susanna Clarke
item.description: "Can a magician kill a man by magic?” Lord Wellington asked Strange. Strange frowned. He seemed to dislike the question. “I suppose a magician might,” he admitted, “but a gentleman never would." -- Susanna Clarke

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Susanna Clarke
item.description: "..The argument he was conducting with his neighbor as to whether the English magician had gone mad because he was a magician, or because he was English." -- Susanna Clarke
